The <InputText/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/inputtext
import { InputText, InputTextField } from "matro-ui"; Copy InputNumber: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components. InputNumberField: The input field itself.
Loading... Copy Live Editor <InputText placeholder="Start typing..."> <InputTextField/> </InputText>
Loading... Copy Live Editor <InputText disabled placeholder="Disabled"> <InputTextField/> </InputText>

Combine <InputNumber/>, <InputText/>, <InputChildSelect/>, <InputChildPrefix/> as you prefer to create any kind of input: Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack column> <LabelText>Example of currency-num</LabelText> <InputNumber placeholder="0.00"> <InputChildPrefix value="$"/> <InputNumberField/> <InputChildSelect name="select-name-prop" defaultValue="pln"> <option value="eur">EUR</option> <option value="usd">USD</option> <option value="pln">PLN</option> </InputChildSelect> </InputNumber> </Stack> Loading... Copy Live Editor function Search () { const [value, setValue] = React.useState("") const handleChange = (e) => { setValue(e.target.value); } return( <Stack column> <LabelText>Example of search</LabelText> <InputText placeholder="Search..." value={value} onChange={handleChange}> <InputTextField/> <InputChildButton children={<IoSearch />} onClick={() => {alert("Query: " + value); setValue("");}}/> </InputText> </Stack> ); } Loading... Copy Live Editor <label> <LabelText>Example of link-text</LabelText> <InputText color="cyangreen" placeholder="example.com" name="input-name-prop" > <InputChildPrefix value="https://"/> <InputTextField/> <InputChildSelect/> </InputText> </label>

value DescriptionThe value of the input. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the input value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring placeholder DescriptionPlaceholder attribute of the input. Typestring disabled DescriptionDisables of the input. Typeboolean

name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring defaultValue DescriptionThe default value of the select input. Typeboolean children Description<option> jsx tags with provided "value" attr TypeReact.FC | React.FC[]
children DescriptionThe string value of the label. Typestring
The <Checkbox/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/checkbox
import { Checkbox } from "matro-ui"; Copy Checkbox: Checkbox element
Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20}}> <Checkbox disabled> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox disabled checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

Pass the font-size to change the size of the Checkbox. Values can be either px, em, rem or %. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "14px"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "16px"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "1.2rem"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

You can override the color scheme of the Checkbox to any color by providing the css variable --bg. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "red"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "#48b048"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "#4848d7"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

value DescriptionThe value of the checkbox. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the checkbox value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the checkbox. Typestring checked DescriptionIndicates whether the checkbox is checked. Typeboolean toggle DescriptionIndicates whether the checkbox is in toggle mode. Typeboolean linear DescriptionIndicates whether the checkbox has a linear type of animation. Typeboolean
Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page: src/pages/index.js → localhost:3000/ src/pages/foo.md → localhost:3000/foo src/pages/foo/bar.js → localhost:3000/foo/bar

Create a file at src/pages/my-react-page.js: src/pages/my-react-page.js import * as React from 'react'; import Layout from '@theme/Layout'; export default function MyReactPage() { return (

My React page

This is a React page

 ); } Copy A new page is now available at http://localhost:3000/my-react-page.
Create a file at src/pages/my-markdown-page.md: src/pages/my-markdown-page.md # My Markdown page This is a Markdown page Copy A new page is now available at http://localhost:3000/my-markdown-page.

Typestring placeholder DescriptionPlaceholder attribute of the input. Typestring disabled DescriptionDisables of the input. Typeboolean

Matro UI provides you with the tools you need to create fast, beautiful and functional user interfaces. Here is an overview of the component categories:
Checkbox Input Number Input Text Radio Select Slider Textarea

To use Matro UI in your project, run one of the following commands in your terminal: npm yarn pnpm bun npm install matro-ui Copy yarn add matro-ui Copy pnpm add matro-ui Copy bun add matro-ui Copy After installing Matra UI, no further actions are required. By design, we decided not to overload Matra with Context Providers and other "heavy" things. However, this may change in the future.

Here's a quick example of how you can do it using something like Create React App: import React from "react"; import * as ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import { Button } from "matro-ui"; ReactDOM.render( <Button>This button looks great.</Button>, document.getElementById("root") ); Copy

You've successfully installed Matro UI and added your first component to your project. Now, you're ready to dive deeper and explore the full range of components and features Matro UI has to offer. Whether you're building a simple website or a complex web application, Matro UI provides you with the tools you need to create beautiful and functional user interfaces. To explore more components, check out the components page. Happy coding!
